Posts.Content: Jan 3, 2011 01:41AM donnalee2001 wrote: Yup. The tissue removed was benign. I can now take my final class for my BSBA and finish that chapter of my life, too. Thanks again for your feedback.
Posts.Title: Mild Ductal Atypical Hyperplasia donnalee2001 SarahsMom

Posts.Content: Dec 23, 2010 03:48PM donnalee2001 wrote: mdoak: I have had 2 radiology surgeons and 2 breast surgeons view my films and read the report. Each area is split. 1 RS and 1 BS say excise, 1 RS and 1BS say just do follow-ups at this point. I am so confused. I almost feel if it were Stage 0 or even 1...I'd have no problem doing the surgery...but I can't see doing it when there is this much "gray" area. I understand that even in more definite cases, the odds are only 10% of anything being beginning states of cancer. I just want to make the right decision...yet nothing is helping me decide. I wish I had a more definite feeling one way or the other.
Posts.Title: Mild Ductal Atypical Hyperplasia donnalee2001 SarahsMom

Posts.Content: Jan 2, 2011 05:57AM donnalee2001 wrote: Decided to do the ductal excision. Results are back. No further a-typical cells found.  I'm glad it's over...for now. Thanks to all of you who added to this discussion. It was a very confusing time for me.
Posts.Title: Mild Ductal Atypical Hyperplasia donnalee2001 SarahsMom
